subject: Re: [junit] Using Parameters to inject data into static field
msgSnippet: Willie, What happens when you run the test?  I m surprised that doesn t work. David
messageBody:
Willie,

What happens when you run the test? I'm surprised that doesn't work.

David

On Mon, Jun 13, 2011 at 6:45 PM, asdflkajsd187 <willie.owens91@...> wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> I'm currently trying to use JUnit to run a number of tests using two different sets of input. However, I need this input to be static fields and it seems I can't change them if they're static. Any way around this?
>
> ex.)
>
> @RunWIth(Parameterized.class)
> public class testMe {
>   static String in1, in2;
>
>   public testMe (String one, String two) {
>      in1 = one;
>      in2 = two;
>   }
>
>   @Parameters
>   public static Collection data() {
>      return Arrays.asList(new Object[][] {{"a1","a2"},{"b1","b2"}};
>   }
>
>   ...etc.
> }
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
